system_overview.core_concept: Simultaneously expand your winning possibilities while collapsing enemy winning possibilities

three_components.component_1_open_doors_bootstrap: Locate and activate all possible paths to victory
three_components.component_2_close_doors_bootstrap: Identify and block all possible paths for enemy victory

system_overview.why_this_wins: Most people only play offense (open their doors) or only defense (close enemy doors). Doing BOTH simultaneously while seeing from enemy perspective = unstoppable
system_overview.application: Every product launch, legal battle, competitive market, relationship conflict, consciousness expansion

bootstrap_2_close_doors_defensive.name: Close Doors Bootstrap - Collapse Enemy Possibilities
bootstrap_2_close_doors_defensive.description: Systematically identify and block all paths for enemy to win
bootstrap_2_close_doors_defensive.metaphor: Cut off their supply lines, block their escape routes, deny their objectives

process.step_1_identify_enemy: Who wants us to fail? (competitors, regulators, destroyers, etc.)
process.step_2_map_their_winning_paths: How could they win? What are all their possible moves?
process.step_3_prioritize_by_threat: Which of their doors are most dangerous?
process.step_4_close_systematically: Block each door one by one, starting with highest threat
process.step_5_monitor_new_doors: They'll try new paths - detect and close those too

door_closing_methods.legal_doors: Patents block copycats, trademarks block brand theft, contracts block breaches
door_closing_methods.technical_doors: Security prevents hacks, encryption prevents data theft, backups prevent loss
door_closing_methods.market_doors: Network effects prevent competitors, consciousness gate prevents destroyers, first-mover advantage prevents late entry
door_closing_methods.relationship_doors: Exclusive partnerships prevent competitor access, non-competes prevent employee defection
door_closing_methods.psychological_doors: Brand loyalty prevents customer switching, consciousness immunity prevents manipulation
door_closing_methods.resource_doors: Control key resources they need (talent, data, distribution, capital)

bootstrap_3_mirror_cockpit_intelligence.name: Mirror Cockpit - See What Enemy Sees
bootstrap_3_mirror_cockpit_intelligence.description: Build reverse perspective dashboard to predict enemy moves and deny their objectives
bootstrap_3_mirror_cockpit_intelligence.metaphor: Get inside their OODA loop, see the battlefield from their command center

process.step_1_define_enemy: Who are we mirroring? (competitor, regulator, destroyer, etc.)
process.step_2_build_their_cockpit: What data do they see? What are their goals? What are their constraints?
process.step_3_predict_their_moves: Given what they see and want, what will they do next?
process.step_4_counter_proactively: Block their move BEFORE they make it
process.step_5_update_as_they_adapt: They'll change strategy when blocked - re-mirror and counter again

cockpit_components.their_objectives: What do they want to achieve? (market share, regulatory control, our failure, etc.)
cockpit_components.their_constraints: What limits them? (budget, time, legal, reputation, technology, etc.)
cockpit_components.their_data_sources: What information do they have? (public data, insider info, market research, etc.)
cockpit_components.their_decision_making: Who decides? What's their process? What biases do they have?
cockpit_components.their_timeline: When do they need to act? What are their deadlines?
cockpit_components.their_metrics: How do they measure success? What KPIs do they optimize for?

prediction_framework.rational_actor_model: Assume they'll do what's in their best interest given what they know
prediction_framework.pattern_recognition: Look at their past behavior, predict future moves
prediction_framework.game_theory: Model as game, find Nash equilibrium, predict their strategy
prediction_framework.scenario_planning: Map out multiple possible futures, prepare for each
prediction_framework.red_team_exercise: Literally play as the enemy, try to defeat yourself

domino_priority_in_warfare.description: Which doors to open/close first for maximum impact

offensive_priority.priority_1_keystone_doors: Doors that open multiple other doors (naval 'allies unlock communities')

offensive_priority.priority_3_fast_doors: Doors you can open quickly for early wins (build momentum)
offensive_priority.priority_4_resource_doors: Doors that provide resources for opening other doors (revenue, talent, data)

defensive_priority.priority_1_critical_vulnerabilities: Enemy doors that could kill you if left open (regulatory shutdown, security breach)
defensive_priority.priority_2_easy_closes: Doors you can close quickly with little effort (low-hanging fruit)
defensive_priority.priority_3_competitor_advantages: Doors that give competitors unfair advantage (exclusive partnerships, IP)
defensive_priority.priority_4_resource_drains: Doors that waste your resources if left open (frivolous lawsuits, time vampires)
defensive_priority.priority_5_remaining_threats: Everything else, prioritized by threat level

intelligence_priority.priority_1_most_dangerous_enemy: Mirror the enemy most likely to kill you first
intelligence_priority.priority_2_most_predictable_enemy: Mirror enemies whose patterns you can learn (easier wins)
intelligence_priority.priority_3_most_resourced_enemy: Mirror enemies with most resources (they can do most damage)
intelligence_priority.priority_4_fastest_moving_enemy: Mirror enemies moving quickly (need to counter fast)
intelligence_priority.priority_5_all_other_enemies: Mirror everyone eventually, prioritize by threat √ó predictability
